short_summary: Two Phase Selection Process - Harbur Cleanup at Parsons Pond
description: This is the first phase of a two-phase competition: the first phase will evaluate the qualifications of all bidders. The second phase will invite the qualified bidders to provide a financial bid on the project under the specifications.
duration_in_months: Our work will consist of removing 19,000m³ of existing granular fill materials and other construction services. We are seeking a construction contractor to perform the work under the specifications provided.
full_summary:
## Invitation to Qualify - Harbour Clean Up, Parson's Pond, Newfoundland and Labrador
**[pdf attachments are available on BuyAndSell.gc.ca](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/10/04/cdc09e5e81ffe2b68ba6c92281125719/30003512_-_request_for_qualification.pdf)**

Fisheries and Oceans Canada invites you to participate in a two-phase competition to provide harbour cleanup services at Parson's Pond, Newfoundland and Labrador. The scope of work includes, but is not limited to, the removal of 19,000 m³ of existing granular fill materials, construction of a berm, and levelling of stockpiles.

**Phase 1 - Qualification Evaluation**

All proponents are invited to submit a proposal to demonstrate their qualifications and experience in performing similar work.

**Phase 2 - Financial Bid**

A shortlist of qualified proponents will be invited to submit a financial bid on the project. The contract will be awarded to the lowest qualified bidder.

**Project Details**

* The project involves the furnishing of all plant, labour, equipment, and materials necessary for harbour cleanup at Parson's Pond, Newfoundland and Labrador.
* The scope of work includes, but is not limited to, removal of granular fill materials, construction of a berm, and levelling of stockpiles.
* The contractor must incorporate COVID-19 standardized protocols in their site-specific Health and Safety Plan.
* The work must be completed within 10 weeks from the date of notification of acceptance of the offer.

**Site Visit**

It is recommended that proponents visit the site and its surroundings to review and verify the form, nature, and extent of the work, materials needed for the completion of the work, the means of access to the site, severity, exposure, and uncertainty of weather, soil conditions, and any accommodations that may be required.

**Key Dates**

* Publication date: October 4, 2022
* Tender closing date: October 18, 2022, 13:00:00 (Eastern Time)
* Contracting entity: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
* End user: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
* Trade agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
